content.rendered:
Birthday over! (Photo by Gratisography)

Hey all, thanks for all the birthday love last week, it’s back to work this week though.

But I’m not sad because I’ve been enjoying working hard on the new Listings feature (you didn’t just think it’d be a list of links did you? 😉 ) and I’ll have more news on that soon (join the beta list – or just refresh the site repeatedly – if you want to know first).

In the meantime though, This Week in Genesis there’s a whole lot going on, including lots of shiny new themes, so let’s start there…

Themes

First up another (yes, another!) third party theme over at StudioPress: Milan Pro by Themetry (and, yes, if you’re a Pro Plus member that means you can just login and download the theme right now).

Rejoice Pro Plus members! New third party theme Milan Pro by @ThemetryHQ now on @studiopress https://t.co/rxEAak1D5k pic.twitter.com/OEmHiEPvCe

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) May 4, 2016

Next up the awesome Susan Nelson with her latest theme called Sweet Pea and sweet it definitely is.

Introducing Sweet Pea – my newest #genesiswp theme! Come check it out: https://t.co/CE349crpQ3 🙂 pic.twitter.com/p5qBok7dRW

— Susan Nelson (@OhHelloDesigns) May 5, 2016

Lauren over at Restored 316 has a new theme called Market.

Introducing our latest #genesiswp #wordpress theme, Market! https://t.co/tU2noFRHk8

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) May 3, 2016

Showcase

First up in the showcase, a great new site (actually, sites) from Ryan Townley, medherosc.com and medheroapp.com

Launched a new #genesiswp site for Medhero Urgent Care: https://t.co/vHHPGG9A8a + their app: https://t.co/wkytDVevLq pic.twitter.com/Q3IgPvT5Jf

— Ryan Townley (@ryantownley) May 5, 2016

Next up, I really love this, a very nice site (for herself) from Stephanie Hellwig for stephaniehellwig.com

Nice new site from Genesis designer / developer @stephanehellwig https://t.co/lsALnYjmhG

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) May 3, 2016

I think this might now be my favourite redesign based on StudioPress’ Digital Pro theme (and I’ve seen a lot). It’s by Helena Denley and her site is wpwebsitecoach.com

Celebrating ?? the launch of our new and improved website https://t.co/7KUoR7lew7 proudly built on #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/7a41NfMSwu

— Helena Denley (@helenadenley) May 2, 2016

And finally in the showcase this week, a new real estate site from Genesis community superstars Tara Claeys and Davinder Singh, advonre.com

So excited to launch this site with my new partnership @getnicework! #genesiswp @idavinder https://t.co/ovo5kCn1ws pic.twitter.com/cBzxK0Eumr

— Tara Claeys (@design_tlc) May 3, 2016

Podcasts

Carrie Dils had a stellar guest on OfficeHours.fm this week, Shawn Hesketh of WP 101 fame (appearing on WP 101), go listen / watch!

I’m live with @leftlane! Tag your questions with #officefm https://t.co/Oa5arbgbYx

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) May 5, 2016

Best of the rest

A big update to her Display Featured Image for Genesis plugin by Robin Cornett.

Display Featured Image for Genesis is updated to 2.5.0! With more new things than will fit in a tweet: https://t.co/iAwj9CsOLo

— Robin Cornett (@robincornett) April 30, 2016

Proving popular on the GenesisWP.guide homepage is this tutorial from the Cre8tive Diva on Adding a Banner Area Before the Header and Below the Footer in Genesis (h/t Sandee Jackson).

Add Banner Area Before the Header and Below the Footer in Genesis https://t.co/XDEK7ly9Ch #bloggers #revenue #wordpress #genesiswp

— Cre8tiveDiva (@TheCre8tiveDiva) May 4, 2016

That clever chap Chinmoy Paul has got a tutorial on creating a checkerboard effect with featured posts on the Atmosphere Pro Home page

Creating checkerboard effect with featured posts on Atmosphere Pro Home page https://t.co/dZGHV5C2Mb #genesiswp

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) April 30, 2016

Also proving popular, this article on where to find WordPress photography themes and why Genesis (h/t Scott).

How To Choose a Photography Website Theme

BobWP moves back to Genesis…

A New Look at BobWP: A Focus on the Blog – and we are back on #Genesiswp https://t.co/mIazwIafaH pic.twitter.com/D0N9tgityc

— BobWP (@bobWP) May 2, 2016

And finally, former GenesisWP.guide interview guest (there’s a claim to fame!), Dave Dean releases an update to his Musket theme.

Musket for WordPress @genesiswp 1.3.2 Released – Musket https://t.co/AuuOTfhMvV

— Dave Dean (@wpmusketeer) May 4, 2016

That’s all for this week, folks. If you need me you can find me saying ‘hey’ on the Genesis Slack group. Have a great weekend.

PS Still not enough? Want even more Genesis? Of course you do! Go check out the homepage, there’s awesome new stuff being added there all the time.

PPS Did I miss your awesome thing? It wasn’t intentional I promise. Go add it to the homepage and fame and fortune will surely follow.

excerpt.rendered: We’re back to work after the birthday celebrations, but there’s a whole host of new themes to cheer us up and some super sharp work happening in the showcase.
